title: Main results and figures
text: file, provide source code case studies discussed manuscript. dataset, first empirically examine relationship missingness (detection) intensity using observed data. Detection proportions modelled logistic regression model fitted average observed intensities precursor-level. design matrix specified basis matrix generated average observed intensities 1, 3 5 degrees freedom. show detection proportion approximately linear average observed intensity logit scale. allow missingness completely random (MCAR) data, also propose capped-logit-linear model detection proportions probability detection capped value smaller equal 1 observations data. Lastly, missingness mechanism formally modelled detection probability curve (DPC), describes probability observation detected given underlying intensity. analyses applied four datasets mentioned main text precursor-level. analyses repeated four example datasets protein-level Supplementary tab vignette.

title: Main results and figures
code: library(tidyverse) library(protDP)

title: Main results and figures
text: Hybrid proteome samples generated mixing human, yeast E.coli lysates different ratios analysed SWATH-MS (Navarro et al. 2016). original dataset (TripleTOF6600; 64-variable-window acquisition) re-processed DIA-NN Demichev et al. (2020). Details experimental procedures data processing steps available Navarro et al. (2016) Demichev et al. (2020). dataset downloaded OSF repository https://doi.org/10.17605/OSF.IO/6G3UX.

previous_headings: Dataset A: Hybrid proteome data
what: Empirical logistic splines for detected proportions
title: Main results and figures
text: Natural cubic splines generated average observed intensities fitted detection proportions 1, 3 5 degrees freedom:  plot corresponds Panel () Figure 1 manuscript.
code: dfList <- seq(1, 5, 2) lineColours <- RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(3, "Dark2") nuis <- getNuisance(dat) allFits <- list() for (df in dfList) {     params0 <- logitSplines_start(dp = nuis$dp, mu = nuis$mu_obs,         wt = nuis$wt, df = df)     fit <- logit_ztbinom(dp = nuis$dp, X = params0$X, wt = nuis$wt,         beta0 = params0$betas_start)     fit$binomEstimate <- params0     allFits[[(df + 1)/2]] <- fit     if (df == 1)         plotEmpSplines(nuis, X = params0$X, fit$params, ylim = c(0,             1.04), lineCol = lineColours[(df + 1)/2])     if (df > 1)         plotEmpSplines(nuis, X = params0$X, fit$params, ylim = c(0,             1.04), lineCol = lineColours[(df + 1)/2], newPlot = FALSE) } legend("bottomright", legend = paste("df = ", dfList), col = lineColours,     lwd = 2, lty = 1, cex = 0.8)

previous_headings: Dataset A: Hybrid proteome data
what: Empirical logistic splines assuming the binomial distribution
title: Main results and figures
text: assumed number detected samples precursor follow zero-truncated binomial distribution previous section. comparison, logistic regression splines next fitted assuming binomial distribution.  plots correspond Figure S2 manuscript.
code: par(mfrow = c(1, 2)) # Plot for precursors of low intensity low <- nuis$mu_obs < 4 nuis_low <- nuis nuis_low$mu_obs <- nuis_low$mu_obs[low] nuis_low$dp <- nuis_low$dp[low] for (df in dfList) {     params0 <- allFits[[(df + 1)/2]]$binomEstimate     fit <- allFits[[(df + 1)/2]]     if (df == 1)         plotEmpSplines(nuis_low, X = params0$X[low, ], params0$betas_start,             xlim = c(0, 4), ylim = c(-2, 2), logit = TRUE, lineCol = lineColours[(df +                 1)/2], lty = "dashed")     plotEmpSplines(nuis_low, X = params0$X[low, ], fit$params,         ylim = c(-2, 2), logit = TRUE, lineCol = lineColours[(df +             1)/2], newPlot = FALSE)     if (df > 1)         plotEmpSplines(nuis_low, X = params0$X[low, ], params0$betas_start,             ylim = c(-2, 2), logit = TRUE, lineCol = lineColours[(df +                 1)/2], lty = "dashed", newPlot = FALSE)     plotEmpSplines(nuis_low, X = params0$X[low, ], fit$params,         logit = TRUE, lineCol = lineColours[(df + 1)/2], ylim = c(-2,             2), newPlot = FALSE) } legend("topleft", legend = c(paste("df = ", dfList), "Binom",     "ZB"), col = c(lineColours, "black", "black"), lwd = 2, lty = c(1,     1, 1, 2, 1), cex = 0.4) for (df in dfList) {     params0 <- allFits[[(df + 1)/2]]$binomEstimate     fit <- allFits[[(df + 1)/2]]     if (df == 1)         plotEmpSplines(nuis_low, X = params0$X[low, ], params0$betas_start,             xlim = c(0, 4), ylim = c(0, 1.04), lineCol = lineColours[(df +                 1)/2], lty = "dashed")     plotEmpSplines(nuis_low, X = params0$X[low, ], fit$params,         ylim = c(0, 1.04), lineCol = lineColours[(df + 1)/2],         newPlot = FALSE)     if (df > 1)         plotEmpSplines(nuis_low, X = params0$X[low, ], params0$betas_start,             ylim = c(0, 1.04), lineCol = lineColours[(df + 1)/2],             lty = "dashed", newPlot = FALSE)     plotEmpSplines(nuis_low, X = params0$X[low, ], fit$params,         ylim = c(0, 1.04), lineCol = lineColours[(df + 1)/2],         newPlot = FALSE) } legend("bottomright", legend = c(paste("df = ", dfList), "Binom",     "ZB"), col = c(lineColours, "black", "black"), lwd = 2, lty = c(1,     1, 1, 2, 1), cex = 0.4)

previous_headings: Dataset A: Hybrid proteome data
what: Reduced deviance compared to an intercept model
title: Main results and figures
text: amount reduced deviance logistic spline compared intercept model calculated. total amount reduced deviance calculated difference largest model 5 degrees freedom intercept model. degrees freedom freed , reduced deviance decreases. percentage reduced deviance total reduced deviance calculated fitted spline.  plot corresponds Table 1 manuscript.
code: params0 <- logitSplines_start(dp = nuis$dp, mu = nuis$mu_obs,     wt = nuis$wt, df = 0) baselineFit <- logit_ztbinom(dp = nuis$dp, X = params0$X, wt = nuis$wt,     beta0 = params0$betas_start) baselineDev <- 2 * min(baselineFit$info[, "neg.LL"]) devs <- data.frame(df = c(0, dfList), dev = c(baselineDev, sapply(allFits,     function(i) 2 * min(i$info[, "neg.LL"])))) %>%     mutate(dev.decre = baselineDev - dev, percDevReduced = dev.decre/max(dev.decre)) ggplot(slice(devs, 2:4), aes(x = df, y = percDevReduced)) + geom_point() +     geom_line() + geom_text(aes(label = signif(percDevReduced,     2)), vjust = -0.8) + scale_x_continuous(breaks = c(1, 3,     5)) + labs(x = "d.f.", y = "Reduced deviance(%)") + ylim(0.95,     1) + theme_classic()

previous_headings: Dataset A: Hybrid proteome data
what: Empirical logit-linear curve with capped probabilities
title: Main results and figures
text: Next allow missingness completely random (MCAR) present data. probability detection observation dataset capped value \(\alpha \(0, 1]\). words, allow proportion (1-\(\alpha\)) observations data missing completely random.  estimated value \(\alpha\) approximately 1. plot corresponds Panel () Figure S3 manuscript.
code: params0 <- logitSplines_start(dp = nuis$dp, mu = nuis$mu_obs,     wt = nuis$wt, df = 1) cappedLinear <- cappedLogit_ztbinom(dp = nuis$dp, X = params0$X,     wt = nuis$wt, alpha0 = 0.9, beta0 = params0$betas_start,     trace = FALSE) round(cappedLinear$params, 2) alpha    b0    b1   1.00 -1.56 15.26  plotEmpSplines(nuis, X = params0$X, cappedLinear$params, capped = TRUE,     lineCol = lineColours[1], ylim = c(0, 1.04))

what: Detection probability curve assuming normal observed intensities
title: Main results and figures
text: plot corresponds Panel () Figure 2 manuscript. estimated parameters
code: dpcFit <- dpc(dat) plotDPC(dpcFit, ylim = c(0, 1.04)) round(dpcFit$beta, 2)    b0    b1  -1.39  0.73

title: Main results and figures
text: Single cell proteomes profiled true single-cell-derived proteomics (T-SCP) pipeline described Brunner et al. (2022). Processed data downloaded ProteomeXchange Consortium via PRIDE partner repository dataset identifier PXD024043. Intensity values zero filtered.

what: Supplementary dataset: Sydney heart bank data
title: Supplementary results and figures
text: Cryopreserved left ventricular myocardium samples human hearts analysed. MS data acquired DIA mode analysed Spectronaunt v12 DDA spectral library generated pooled sample (Li et al. 2020). Details sample preparation, LC-MS/MS workflow data processing steps including generation spectial library can found Li et al. (2020). consider healthy donor heart samples. precursor- protein group-level data log2-transformed analysis.

code: res <- list(prec = gatherResults(shbheart_prec), prot = gatherResults(shbheart_prot,     b0.upper = Inf)) par(mfrow = c(2, 1)) for (res_i in 1:2) {     eachRes <- res[[res_i]]     for (i in 1:length(dfList)) {         if (i == 1)             plotEmpSplines(eachRes$nuis, X = eachRes$splineFits_params0[[i]]$X,                 eachRes$splineFits[[i]]$params, lineCol = lineColours[i],                 jitter.amount = 1/ncol(shbheart_prec)/2, point.cex = 0.15)         if (i > 1)             plotEmpSplines(eachRes$nuis, X = eachRes$splineFits_params0[[i]]$X,                 eachRes$splineFits[[i]]$params, lineCol = lineColours[i],                 newPlot = FALSE)     }     title(sub = c("Precursor-level", "Protein-level")[res_i])     legend("bottomright", legend = paste("df = ", dfList), col = lineColours,         lwd = 2, lty = 1, cex = 0.8) }

what: Supplementary dataset: UPS1 spiked-in yeast extract
title: Supplementary results and figures
text: Three concentrations UPS1 (25 fmol, 10 fmol 5 fmol) spiked yeast extract (Giai Gianetto et al. 2016). DDA dataset MS raw data processed MaxQuant. look dataset compares 25 fmol 10 fmol spiked-ins. Processed data downloaded ProteomeXchange Consortium via PRIDE partner repository dataset identifier PXD002370. peptide-level data, use peptides.txt file protein-level analysis, use proteinGroups.txt file MaxQuant output. Log2-transformation first applied analysis.

what:
Estimation of the Detection Probability Curve in Label Free Shotgun 
    Proteomics Data
title:
Estimation of the Detection Probability Curve in Label Free Shotgun 
    Proteomics Data
text: relationship missingness intensity evaluated label-free shotgun proteomics data. Using series publicly available datasets, first empirically investigate missingness-intensity relationship observed data. also propose model detection probability describes probability observation detected given underlying intensity label-free shotgun proteomics data.

title:
Estimation of the Detection Probability Curve in Label Free Shotgun 
    Proteomics Data
text: Li, M. Smyth, G.K., 2023. Neither random censored: estimating intensity-dependent probabilities missing values label-free proteomics. Bioinformatics, 39(5), btad200.

title:
Estimation of the Detection Probability Curve in Label Free Shotgun 
    Proteomics Data

code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Mengbo-Li/protDP")

title:
Estimation of the Detection Probability Curve in Label Free Shotgun 
    Proteomics Data
text: interested investigating relationship intensity detection/missing values proteomics dataset, can try following quick start: dat log2-intensity matrix, rows precursors/proteins columns samples, dat contains missing values NA. plotDPC() function visualises detection probability curve (DPC) can inspect whether missingness dependent underlying intensity values dataset. tells whether missingness missing random (MNAR).
code: dpcfit <- dpc(dat) plotDPC(dpcfit)

Fitting an empirical logistic spline curve for detection proportion with

code: cappedLogit_ztbinom(   dp,   X,   wt,   alpha0 = 0.8,   beta0,   maxit = 100,   trace = TRUE,   eps = 1e-04 )

title:
Fitting an empirical logistic spline curve for detection proportion with
capped probabilities — cappedLogit_ztbinom
text: dp vector detection proportion precursors. X basis matrix natural cubic spline. wt vector numbers trials (samples size) zero-truncated binomial distribution. alpha0 start value alpha. beta0 Start values beta coefficients. maxit Maximum number iterations. trace Logical. Whether print alpha estimates iteration. eps Convergence tolerance.
